name: Hardest Yttrium Trivia Quiz | Chemistry | 5 Questions

questions.correct: The town it was found near, Ytterby, Sweden
options: The name of the university it was discovered at, backwards (Muirtty)
questions.explanation:
The town it was found near, Ytterby, Sweden.

	It and 3 other elements -- erbium, terbium, and ytterbium -- are named after this village near Vauxholm, Sweden. It is the site of a quarry that yields many rare earths and other elements.

questions.text: Yttrium's main commercial use is in:
questions.explanation:
Phosphors (dots) on color TV tubes.

	The red dots, actually.

questions.text: How many stable isotopes of yttrium are known?
questions.explanation:
1.

	Only Y-89 is stable. 19 other unstable ones have been characterized.
